MOTHER: He’s no hatchling of ours. Who is he?
SERGEANT: He’s a spy.
MOTHER: Our Doctor must be here. Where is he? Where is he, General? Answer me or I'll tear you limb from limb from limb.

elements.text: [Part Four]
Our Mother.
Doctor, be careful.
General to you. Our Mother, listen. I have news of the Doctor.
He’s off his head.
Where is the Doctor?
Closer than you think. But he’s an elusive fellow, hard to pin down, even worse to catalogue.
Ah.
Practical, witty, clubbable, sought after in all major star systems.
He is registered already.
Some people believe anything.
And you are his envoy.
He expresses concern over your plans.
Attend us, General. Up here, on our wagon. We value your counsel.
At your service.
He can't just leave us.
General, what about us?
Try to reach spacedrome, cause as much disruption as you can. Anything to delay proceedings.
Gotcha.
General!
And answer to numbers, not names. Think termite.
General.
Here, Our Mother. On board.
All columns forward, advance.
I can’t... I can’t do this.
Shut up, Gerium.
You two. Yes, you. The egg teams need help. Don’t just stand there. On the triple! The hatchlings don’t wait for their dinner.
The reconstruction proceeds apace, Our Mother. Old buildings on the move, cannibalised to fortify the Registry as your new Termitry.
We remember every one of our children. Every worker, every soldier. But we do not know you. Stand closer. Oh, it’s so hard to focus.
Have you thought about glasses?
Ah, you are no envoy. You are him. Somehow you are the Doctor.
Shh. We're not alone. It’s not for public antennae.
What? Why are our nurses waiting here? What is it?
Our Mother, your current egg rate.
Well?
Two, our mother.
What’s that?
Down to two a minute, Our Mother.
Two? Impossible. How can we be so unreproductive?
With your workload it’s no surprise. I think a full medical check-up might be in order.
And what would the Doctor say?
The Doctor would tell you to abdicate or whatever royalty does, and do it right now.
Never.
Fanfare.
Grubs, you are all heroic workers. Already our new citadel rises to crown our labours. It leads us on to ultimate glory.
Workers cheer.
(sotto) I could crush you at any time, Doctor.
Oh, all right, all right. It’s me. (wibble) There, no point in hiding. So, go on, do your worst.7
What do you want?
I want to help you. I want to stop you leading your people into absolute disaster.
Warriors, take the slack. Triple march to Registry! Forward on the triple.
We’re speeding up, Jewan.
This egg weighs a ton. How do we get away now? What’s happening?
Dunno. We'll make a run for it.
To the spacedrome? We'll never make it.
Groaning.
Just try to breath slowly.
Did the humans send you to plague me, Doctor?
Perhaps I could start your examination. (slightly distant) I'll be round here.
No more trickery.
Please hold still. You’re turning Valhalla into a human retail park. How do you think Earth will react?
Earth turned its back long ago. And we are superior, industrious, intelligent.
You've certainly come up in the world. Oh dear. Your blood pressure’s very high.
Long ago, in the reign of Our Mother the First, humans engineered a team of heroic termite pioneers to burrow into the heart of Callisto, seeking new energy sources.
Assisted evolution. You have been in the wars. Your reflexes are almost negligible.
When Earth cut Valhalla off, no one even remembered us. But we kept working, sending years of data back to the Registry. And we were outside Valhalla’s gravity pan.
Hence your size. Jupiter’s infamous gravity fluxes let you termites grow massively in just a few generations. And then the traffic of data to Registry started going both ways.
Our termites seek out all resources. The universe is our market.
And humans are difficult to keep, going off their food in captivity, losing market value.
We have the means.
(close) Not you, Our Mother.
What?
I fear your condition is in terminal decline. Bad diet, constant stress. You don’t have long to live.
You think we did not know that?
For your people’s sake, stop this disastrous plan now.
It will be our triumph. Grubs, Registration must be started!
This egqg’s shifting like... like it’s on edge.
Mine too. Edge towards the side streets. (loud) You come near me and I'll smash this egg.
Put down those eggs. Gently.
Jevvan, mine’s cracking!
Give us some help.
Gerium roars, the egg breaks, a grub chitters.
Get back.
Run!
Get after them!
TIN-MARIE [tannoy]: Okay, everyone getting this? I’m Tin-Marie Fisher.
Hub-bub of crowd.

TIN-MARIE [tannoy]: Listen! Security’s sealed off the spacedrome corridors. It’s sealed because termites are in the building! So we can sit here or fight back. There’s a carrier on dock 4. If some of us can hack through we might get a message out. The rest must keep the termites busy. We’ve one chance. Work together, distract them. Riot. A proper riot this time, yeah? One you don’t need a ticket for! Cos that’s what we’re good at! Do it before they do!
Cheers.
Our Mother, the human livestock are growing agitated.
Full registration must be instigated. Carry us inside Registry now.
But the entrance is too small for you to enter.
Then widen it! Bite harder, and don’t keep us waiting.
Our Mother, the programme must commence. We may lose the stock.
My innards are churning.
As your physician, I advise you not to move. I can fetch out drugs from Registry
Our Mother coughs.
Our Mother?
Oh, go on. And take the Doctor with you. Let him prove his worth.
Thank you, Our Mother.
But watch him. One trick and you may slice him to pieces.
Gerium, down here, out of sight.
The place is crawling. We'll never get to the spacedrome, not like this.
Let’s lose these disguises too. Better without them.
Yeah, maybe. (wibble) Ah.
I don’t believe it. Look what they’ve parked out there.
Scrumming hell. The whole building.
The whole Tchaikovsky Towers. Stores, wheels, everything. Doctor told us to make trouble, and there’s enough therms there for a million termites.
Stand by.
There they go. Our glorious Mother’s codes unloading.
What is registration? Some form of stock-take?
It transfers all tradeable human livestock onto the catalogue.
Suppose I want to peruse the glorious stock?
You have no designated access. Fetch out the drugs.
Just checking.
Codes accepted. Catalogue ready and launched.
Too late. What’s this doing here? Shouldn't eggs be kept in the hatchery?
Leave it alone.
Just a tuning fork. All eggs have a weak spot.
Egg cracking, groan and coughing.
Oh dear.
Alert! Livestock escaping!
Teddy Laxton. Here, let me.
Get away from me.
It’s me, the Doctor, remember?
Doctor.
Stand away.
Quiet. Do you want an encore?
Alert. Assistance required.
System 12 override. Drop blast shield.
Rumble, squish, gurgling, termite dies.
Thank you, Mister Laxton. Sorry about the shell-shock.
The barrier won’t hold for long.
Long enough.
What are you back for?
Your friend, the termite Queen, has terrible plans - trafficking innocent people into slavery, destroying her own children’s future — but you can stop her.
Me?
Unlock the comm systems. Use those broadcast skills you’re so proud of, and do it quickly, before she drags us all into the abyss.
Let us go! Let us go! (continues under -)
TIN-MARIE: We only need distract the termites for a minute, just to reach the ship and get a message out. More, come on!
That's it, let it rip! Ready, Tin-Marie?
TIN-MARIE: Okay. Open up. Let’s go for it. Oh God, shut the door! They’re getting in! Get back, all of you!
Chittering.
Stand by. Registration of livestock will commence. Move forward when your number is called. 121A Richard Harrison Joseph. Richard Harrison Joseph.
Here.
Crowd groans.
Stand forward. Crouch.
Muffled moaning and crunching.
TIN-MARIE: Is that what happens? We all get packaged in neat little shelves.
126A Evgeny Anderson Sonora. Evgeny Anderson
2: I’m here. Ah!
Hurry up, Laxton.
Give me time, will you? All right, ready to broadcast. Let’s get this over.
Crash!
Oh, Our Mother.
You tricked me, Doctor.
Of course I tricked you. Your slave trade is offensive to the whole universe. I am closing you down.
Hold them.
Laxton and the Doctor cry out.
A fine doctor you are, Doctor. Let’s see how you fare on the open market.
265K Tin-Marie Fisher. Stand forward. TIN-MARIE: She’s gone. Dead and gone. Absent without leave. Get off me!
265K Tin-Marie Fisher.
Big boom, termite panic.
Get away, you filthy things. Get away.
Boom.
Jevvan, there’s too many of them.
Get away! (boom) There’s plenty more of these. Who wants one next?
Where’s everyone? They’re not here.
Just the eggs. God, there’s no one left.
Jevvan, look out!
Jevvan and Gerium scream.
Gerium!
The catalogue features a broad range of skilled livestock.
Not so much of the livestock. Humans are people too.
Ho, ho, ha, ha. Registration is on-going.
Our Mother, I should never have trusted you. You and Registry. Let me go!
We have rights too. This city was all but finished when we returned.
You rang me direct. Mister Mayor, our mission is complete. We have the new energy source you were seeking. You were lying even then.
Our termites saved Valhalla.
For yourselves.
Is this the civilisation you dream of?
Civilisation is what humans smear across the open wound they leave on the face of the universe. But we can do better.
Interest is being registered.
Ah.
Interest?
Three expressions. Correction, four. Five expressions.
In which retail item?
Item 3X91-12.
That’s you, Doctor. They want to buy you.
Me? You said I wasn’t for sale. Let me see that.
Release them.
Thank you.
Eight expressions now.
Alarm sounds.
Emergency. Registration procedure is under attack.
Go. Protect the livestock.
Termites leave.
Laxton, do it. Make the broadcast.
Our Mother roars, Laxton cries out.
She’s crushing me.
I’ve no choice left, Our Mother. I'll do it myself.
(weak) She...
Tin-Marie. Tin-Marie, will you scrumming answer? They're getting in and we need to deploy the whole therm in one big blast. Tin-Marie, just answer! No! Get off! Get off!
391Q Jevvan Petrovna Hadria retrieved. Take for immediate registration.
[OC]: Attention. Here is an announcement. It is with the deepest regret that we announce the passing of Our Mother the Fourth.
Who has died peacefully in her sleep.
What’s he saying? Stop him.
Her legacy remains. Her people endure. Long live the Queen. (comms off)
Doctor, out the window.
Has it started?
Winged soldiers, thousands of them.
No.
They’re swarming from every crack. They’ll cover the city.
Our children, we are here.
Not any more, Our late lamented Mother. I brought the future so you can escape the past.
Our children, we are not dead. Stop them. Do not desert us.
It’s the wedding flight. When the old monarch dies, the new grooms take to the air in a frenzied hunt to find a new Queen.
But she’s not dead yet.
The wheels of history are turning. There’s no going back.
Call them back. Stop it.
Laxton, it’s the moment of chaos. Flush Registry of her influence and get help for your people.
I’ll break the link now. Our Mother.
You as well, Laxton?
Be careful.

You lied to me. You snatch whatever you're given. I don’t have many friends, that goes with the job, but it’s the contempt I hate. You and Registry, behind my back. I’ll break the link. Better to have nothing at all!
No, Laxton, don’t touch
Laxton screams. Electricity sizzles. Boom.
Warning. Link broken. (slows) Registry is shutting down.
Powers down.
Mother is dead. Long live the new Queen.
Jevvan is crying.
TIN-MARIE: Jewvan?
It’s you. Oh, Tin-Marie, I thought you were
TIN-MARIE: I was. All packed up in one of those egg things, till someone called my vid-com. You woke me up, Jevvan.
Me?
TIN-MARIE: You woke me up. Managed to kick my way out.
But the termites?
TIN-MARIE: All gone, soon as the alarms went off. I headed for the Resolute and got a may-day through to Ganymede.
So they’re coming. Rescue ships.
TIN-MARIE: We’re the only two awake. Us and a couple of thou eggs. Hell Knows how we wake them all.
Easy, if the lines are still working. Well, everyone’s got a comm, right?
TIN-MARIE: What are you doing?
Blanket call.
Vid-coms start ringing all over the place.
See? Everyone’s got acomm.
Eggs cracking.
TIN-MARIE: Scrumming hell, you did it! You woke up the world, Jevvan. What’s that?
The sky.
The swarm.
(weak) Listen to them, out there. Have they found our successor yet? Our Mother the Fifth. Will time be kinder to her?

Time? You mean that dreadful wingéd chariot hurrying near? But it never hurries. Oh no, it trundles. Just when you think you’re ahead, crunch, it sneaks up behind and mows you down, or overtakes in the slow lane.
Hush now, Doctor.
And then I saw your catalogue. All those nice, straight-forward, uncomplicated jobs, and I thought — I could do that. I’ve had enough of being me. For sale, one Tardis, vintage condition. Any offers.
Not you, Doctor. You cannot deny them.
Them? Who are they?
All those bidders. Fortunate you are to be in such demand.
You’re right, of course. It'll never happen. Fat chance. There’s too much to do. The universe is too busy. I can hardly deny my admirers, can I? Our Mother? Oh, so you’ve let go at last.
(nervous man) Er, attention. Carrier now boarding at gate 5. Don’t push, folks. There’s room for all of you.
TIN-MARIE: Jewan? Better get on board. No point in waiting.
Gerium, Loz, the Doctor.
TIN-MARIE: I know.
Flying’s stopped though. The termites, I mean.
TIN-MARIE: Ganymede Control said the weirdest thing. The First Encounter Bureau on Earth was contacted about this place, and the message was from bloody Laxton, sent days ago.
He had a lot of foresight did Teddy Sergeivitch.
Doctor!
Oh yes. The Bureau is obliged to take notice and open dialogue. If the next Queen will listen. TIN-MARIE: Weird. So, I'll just... don’t be long, Jevvan.
How did you get here?
It flies too, you see. Short jumps, long jumps. You’ll see on the way home. Any other luggage?
Home?
Isn’t that where you’re going?
Yeah, but er...
Well, I'll have you back in time for your birthday.
Doesn’t take a year to get to Earth.
The birthday you just missed. Home in a twinkling. Before a twinkling can even start.
No.
What?
Not like that. Don’t just assume.
Scenic destinations, wine-dark skies, forests of smoke.
Bet you say that to everyone.
I try to vary it.
No, I’m sorry. I want to see the bits in between, out the window. No point in travelling if I don’t see where I’m going.
Ah.
So thanks, Doctor, but no thanks.
A person with ambition. Where’s Gerium?
Better go. Sorry. See you.
I hope so. (sighs) Never mind, Doctor, for the moment.
Hangar doors open and close.
Time to get off. (Tardis door opens.) Nothing to share. Playing solitaire.
Tardis door closes.
[OC]: Poetry. I can do that.
The Tardis dematerialises.
[OC]: Or take up the trombone. Hmm.
